franklin_inicio.texto: One day, Ben Franklin wanted to win over an enemy.
franklin_inicio.fonetica: wʌn deɪ bɛn ˈfræŋklɪn ˈwɑnɪd tə wɪn ˈoʊvɚ ən ˈɛnəmi

favor_libro.texto: He asked to borrow a rare book, and the man agreed.
favor_libro.fonetica: hi æskt tə ˈbɑɹoʊ ə ɹɛɹ bʊk ənd ðə mæn əˈɡɹid

favor_efecto.texto: That favor changed their bond; sympathy was born.
favor_efecto.fonetica: ðæt ˈfeɪvɚ tʃeɪndʒd ðɛɹ bɑnd ˈsɪmpəθi wəz bɔɹn

efecto_benfranklin.texto: That’s called the Ben Franklin effect: helping connects more than receiving.
efecto_benfranklin.fonetica: ðæts kɔld ðə bɛn ˈfræŋklɪn əˈfɛkt ˈhɛlpɪŋ kəˈnɛkts mɔɹ ðæn ɹɪˈsivɪŋ

vendedor_sonriente.texto: A smiling salesman knocked on Martha’s door.
vendedor_sonriente.fonetica: ə ˈsmaɪlɪŋ ˈseɪlzˌmən nɑkt ɑn ˈmɑɹθəz dɔɹ

pie_en_puerta.texto: He only asked to place a small sign in her yard.
pie_en_puerta.fonetica: hi ˈoʊnli æskt tə pleɪs ə smɔl saɪn ɪn hɚ jɑɹd

marta_acepta.texto: Martha said yes; it didn’t seem like a big deal.
marta_acepta.fonetica: ˈmɑɹθə sɛd jɛs ɪt ˈdɪdənt sim laɪk ə bɪɡ dil

poster_grande.texto: Days later, he asked to post a huge one, and she agreed.
poster_grande.fonetica: deɪz ˈleɪtɚ hi æskt tə poʊst ə hjudʒ wʌn ənd ʃi əˈɡɹid

tecnica_pie_puerta.texto: That’s the foot-in-the-door technique: start small, end big.
tecnica_pie_puerta.fonetica: ðæts ðə fʊt ɪn ðə dɔɹ tɛkˈnik stɑɹt smɔl ɛnd bɪɡ

mercado_regateo.texto: At the market, John is bargaining for a carpet.
mercado_regateo.fonetica: æt ðə ˈmɑɹkɪt dʒɑn ɪz ˈbɑɹɡənɪŋ fɔɹ ə ˈkɑɹpɪt

sesgo_anclaje.texto: The seller says: it’s a thousand, though it’s worth two hundred.
sesgo_anclaje.fonetica: ðə ˈsɛlɚ sɛz ɪts ə ˈθaʊzənd ðoʊ ɪts wɝθ tu ˈhʌndɹəd

juan_contrapropuesta.texto: John offers five hundred, and both end up happy.
juan_contrapropuesta.fonetica: dʒɑn ˈɔfɚz faɪv ˈhʌndɹəd ənd boʊθ ɛnd ʌp ˈhæpi

anclaje_explicacion.texto: That’s the anchoring bias: the first number sets the tone.
anclaje_explicacion.fonetica: ðæts ði ˈæŋkɚɪŋ ˈbaɪəs ðə fɝst ˈnʌmbɚ sɛts ðə toʊn

reunion_tensa.texto: In the meeting, everyone spoke at once.
reunion_tensa.fonetica: ɪn ðə ˈmitɪŋ ˈɛvɹiˌwʌn spoʊk ət wʌns

poder_silencio.texto: Maria went silent, and the silence weighed like a mountain.
poder_silencio.fonetica: məˈɹiə wɛnt ˈsaɪlənt ənd ðə ˈsaɪləns weɪd laɪk ə ˈmaʊntən

ganar_silencio.texto: The other gave in. The power of silence won.
ganar_silencio.fonetica: ði ˈʌðɚ ɡeɪv ɪn ðə ˈpaʊɚ ʌv ˈsaɪləns wʌn

cafe_espejo.texto: While drinking coffee, Anna mirrored Peter’s gestures.
cafe_espejo.fonetica: waɪl ˈdrɪŋkɪŋ ˈkɔfi ˈænə ˈmɪɹɚd ˈpitɚz ˈdʒɛstʃɚz

efecto_espejo.texto: That’s the mirror effect: reflecting builds connection.
efecto_espejo.fonetica: ðæts ðə ˈmɪɹɚ əˈfɛkt ɹɪˈflɛktɪŋ bɪldz kəˈnɛkʃən

radio_repetida.texto: You hear a song and don’t like it.
radio_repetida.fonetica: ju hɪɹ ə sɔŋ ənd doʊnt laɪk ɪt

repeticion_gusto.texto: They play it twenty times, and you end up humming it happily.
repeticion_gusto.fonetica: ðeɪ pleɪ ɪt ˈtwɛni taɪmz ənd ju ɛnd ʌp ˈhʌmɪŋ ɪt ˈhæpɪli

efecto_exposicion.texto: That’s the mere exposure effect: familiarity pleases.
efecto_exposicion.fonetica: ðæts ðə mɪɹ ɪkˈspoʊʒɚ əˈfɛkt fəˌmɪlˈjɛɹɪti ˈplizɪz

nombre_magia.texto: At the store, the seller says: 'Thanks, John!'
nombre_magia.fonetica: æt ðə stɔɹ ðə ˈsɛlɚ sɛz θæŋks dʒɑn

escuchar_nombre.texto: And John smiles, not knowing why.
escuchar_nombre.fonetica: ənd dʒɑn smaɪlz nɑt ˈnoʊɪŋ waɪ

efecto_nombre.texto: Hearing your name sparks instant trust.
efecto_nombre.fonetica: ˈhɪɹɪŋ jɔɹ neɪm spɑɹks ˈɪnstənt tɹʌst

supermercado_confusion.texto: Lucy went to the supermarket and saw thirty kinds of jam.
supermercado_confusion.fonetica: ˈlusi wɛnt tə ðə ˈsupɚˌmɑɹkɪt ənd sɔ ˈθɝɾi kaɪndz ʌv dʒæm

paradoja_eleccion.texto: She froze. Too many choices paralyzed her.
paradoja_eleccion.fonetica: ʃi fɹoʊz tu ˈmɛni ˈtʃɔɪsɪz ˈpæɹəˌlaɪzd hɚ

analisis_paralisis.texto: That’s the paradox of choice: more options, more freeze.
analisis_paralisis.fonetica: ðæts ðə ˈpæɹəˌdɑks ʌv tʃɔɪs mɔɹ ˈɑpʃənz mɔɹ fɹiz

tele_noticia.texto: After watching three news shows on crashes, Laura didn’t want to drive.
tele_noticia.fonetica: ˈæftɚ ˈwɑtʃɪŋ θɹi nuz ʃoʊz ɑn ˈkræʃɪz ˈlɔɹə ˈdɪdənt wɑnt tə draɪv

heuristica_disponibilidad.texto: That’s the availability heuristic: we think what’s recent is common.
heuristica_disponibilidad.fonetica: ðæts ði əˌveɪləˈbɪlɪɾi hjʊˈɹɪstɪk wi θɪŋk wʌts ˈɹisənt ɪz ˈkɑmən

manada_inicio.texto: In the square, everyone rushes to a new store.
manada_inicio.fonetica: ɪn ðə skwɛɹ ˈɛvɹiˌwʌn ˈɹʌʃɪz tu ə nu stɔɹ

efecto_bandwagon.texto: You join in too, not knowing why.
efecto_bandwagon.fonetica: ju dʒɔɪn ɪn tu nɑt ˈnoʊɪŋ waɪ

efecto_manada.texto: That’s the herd effect, or bandwagon: we follow the crowd by inertia.
efecto_manada.fonetica: ðæts ðə hɝd ɪˈfɛkt ɔɹ ˈbændˌwæɡən wi ˈfɑloʊ ðə kɹaʊd baɪ ɪˈnɝʃə

cirujano_confusion.texto: A patient is in surgery, and his mother is the surgeon.
cirujano_confusion.fonetica: ə ˈpeɪʃənt ɪz ɪn ˈsɝdʒɚi ənd hɪz ˈmʌðɚ ɪz ðə ˈsɝdʒən

sesgo_cirujano.texto: But some are surprised—they pictured a man.
sesgo_cirujano.fonetica: bʌt sʌm ɑɹ səˈpɹaɪzd ðeɪ ˈpɪktʃɚd ə mæn

explicacion_sesgo_cirujano.texto: That’s the surgeon bias: stereotypes blind reason.
explicacion_sesgo_cirujano.fonetica: ðæts ðə ˈsɝdʒən ˈbaɪəs ˈstɛɹiəˌtaɪps blaɪnd ˈɹizən

resumen_silencio.texto: Sometimes, silence speaks louder than words.
resumen_silencio.fonetica: ˈsʌmtaɪmz ˈsaɪləns spiks ˈlaʊdɚ ðæn wɝdz

resumen_nombre.texto: Your name is a melody of trust.
resumen_nombre.fonetica: jɔɹ neɪm ɪz ə ˈmɛlədi ʌv tɹʌst

resumen_eleccion.texto: Too many choices cloud the mind.
resumen_eleccion.fonetica: tu ˈmɛni ˈtʃɔɪsɪz klaʊd ðə maɪnd

final_aprendizaje.texto: To negotiate and think without bias—that’s the real superpower.
final_aprendizaje.fonetica: tə nəˈɡoʊʃiˌeɪt ənd θɪŋk wɪˈðaʊt ˈbaɪəs ðæts ðə ɹiəl ˈsupɚˌpaʊɚ
